cdetidy 0.1.0

Validate SQL-safe table or column names

Source: R/validate_sql_identifiers.R
validate_sql_identifiers.Rd

Checks that each name in a character vector follows SQL identifier rules: - Starts with a letter or underscore - Contains only letters, numbers, or underscores - Does not exceed a specified maximum length

Usage

validate_sql_identifiers(
  name_vec,
  type = c("column", "table"),
  max_length = 63
)

Arguments

name_vec

A character vector of names to validate.

type

A string indicating what type of identifier is being checked. Must be `"column"` or `"table"`. Default is `"column"`.

max_length

Maximum number of characters allowed in a name. Default is 63.

Value

Invisibly returns `NULL`. Raises an error if any invalid names are found.

Details

- This function enforces safe naming for SQL Server and PostgreSQL-style identifiers. - Colored error messages are printed for easier debugging in interactive sessions.

Examples

validate_sql_identifiers(c("student_id", "_school_code"))  # ✅ valid
validate_sql_identifiers(c("123bad", "with space"), type = "column")  # ❌ will error
#> Error in validate_sql_identifiers(c("123bad", "with space"), type = "column"): ❌ Invalid SQL column name(s): 123bad, with space
#> ⚠️ Must start with a letter or underscore, and contain only letters, numbers, or underscores.
